organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells for Ischemic Stroke (UMSIS): a Prospective, Double-blinded, Randomized Controlled, Pilot Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This is a doble blind, placebo controlled clinical trial to assess safety and efficacy of intravenous administration of Umbilical cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem cells in patients with ischemic stroke within 6 months of onset.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Two different treatment groups; intravenous umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells or intravenous placebo solution

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Treatment and placebo solutions have identical appearance. Protocols will be designed to ensure that the physician evaluating patient safety and efficacy outcome as well as laboratory analysis, will not have access to the randomisation codes.

armGroups.label: Treatment group
armGroups.description: intravenous umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells
interventionNames: Biological: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells

armGroups.label: Placebo Comparator
armGroups.description: intravenous placebo solution with the same appearance as the treatment group.

interventions.name: Umbilical Cord-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells
interventions.description: umbilical cord derived mesenchymal stem cells were intravenously injected in a single dose of one hundred million.

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: intravenous placebo solution with the same appearance as the treatment group.

primaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome

secondaryOutcomes.description: the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS mean a worse outcome
Fugl-Meyer Assessment Scale ranges from 0 to 100.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in Purdue hand function test
secondaryOutcomes.description: The changes of fine motor function were evaluated by Purdue hand function test

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in box and block test
secondaryOutcomes.description: The changes of fine motor function were evaluated by box and block test
the minimum and maximum values of mRS are 0 and 6, respectively; higher mRS

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in the national institutes of health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: NIHSS ranges from 0-42, and high NIHSS means bad outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: changes in Mini-mental State Examination (MMSE) score
changes in Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score

secondaryOutcomes.description: serum biomarkers included CPEC, VEGF, BDNF, MMP-9

overallOfficials.name: Chen Hui-Sheng, Doctor
overallOfficials.affiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command
